text.text: How do I access the Credit Posting report?

text: To access the Credit Posting report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Credit Posting. 3. Select the following options: Show Deactivated Users, Posted by, Start and End Date, Date Filter Type, and Display HCPCS. 4. Click View Report.

text.text: What information does the Credit Posting report display?

text: The Credit Posting report displays the amounts posted or deposited by one specific biller or all billers on a daily basis. It can be used to compare the posted amount to your bank statement and as an indicator of payment posting productivity.

text.text: How can I choose to show deactivated users in the Credit Posting report?

text: To show deactivated users in the Credit Posting report, you can select the "Show Deactivated Users" option.

text.text: What options do I have for selecting billers in the Credit Posting report?

text: You can select all billers or one or more users. You can also select the start and end date for the report.

text.text: What date range options are available for the Credit Posting report?

text: You can select the deposit date or post date for the report. You can also select the "Display HCPCS" option to show HCPCS in the report.

text.text: Can I choose between Deposit Date and Post Date for filtering in the Credit Posting report?

text: Yes, you can choose between Deposit Date and Post Date for filtering in the Credit Posting report.

text.text: What additional option can I select to include HCPCS in the Credit Posting report?

text: You can select the "Display HCPCS" option to show HCPCS in the report.

text.text: How do I view the Credit Posting report once I've selected my preferences?

text: To view the Credit Posting report, you can click "View Report".

text.text: What is the recommended frequency for running the Credit Posting report?

text: The recommended frequency for running the Credit Posting report is daily. This is because the report displays the amounts posted or deposited by one specific biller or all billers on a daily basis. The report can be used to compare the posted amount to your bank statement and to use as an indicator of payment posting productivity.

text.text: What is the main purpose of the Credit Posting report?

text: The main purpose of the Credit Posting report is to display the amounts posted or deposited by one specific biller or all billers on a daily basis.

text.text: How do I access the All Payment Details report?

text: To access the All Payment Details report, you can click on the "Reports" tab and then scroll down to the "All Payment Details" link. You can also access the report by clicking on the "Analytics" tab and then clicking on the "Reports" tab.

text.text: What specific payment activity does the All Payment Details report contain?

text: The All Payment Details report contains payment activity by claims from the line item level down to the charge level.

text.text: What columns of information are included in the All Payment Details report?

text: The All Payment Details report contains the following columns of information: Accounting period, Level of service, Claim number, Policy, Date of service, Posted by and posted date, Claim charge amount, Profit center, Claim payment amount, Transaction number, Deposit date, Transaction total, HCPCS code, quantity, and payment amount, Transaction type.

text.text: What is the recommended action for better digesting the information in the All Payment Details report?

text: The recommended action for better digesting the information in the All Payment Details report is to export the report to a .csv file. You can then view and manage the data in the file.

text.text: What is the recommended action for better digesting the information in the All Payment Details report?

text: The recommended action for better digesting the information in the All Payment Details report is to export the report to a .csv file. You can then view and manage the data in the file.

text.text: What types of data management can I perform on the exported .csv file?

text: If you are not good with Excel, we have some great videos that will get you started.

text.text: Where can I find resources if I need help with managing the data in Excel?

text: You can find resources on managing data in Excel at https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Reports Holder/Using Excel to manipulate report data.htm 2/3.

text.text: How does the All Payment Details report help in analyzing payment activity?

text: The All Payment Details report contains payment activity by claims from the line item level down to the charge level. This report provides the claim level detail that you can't see when looking into payments for an accounting period as that information appears at the transaction level.

text.text: Can I customize the view of the All Payment Details report?

text: Yes, you can customize the view of the All Payment Details report. You can select the accounting period date, profit centers, and whether to include inactive profit center zones or HCPCS.

text.text: What distinguishes the All Payment Details report from other payment reports?

text: The All Payment Details report provides claim level detail that you can't see when looking into payments for an accounting period.

text.text: How do I access the Projected Revenue report?

text: To run the Projected Revenue report, you need to pick a parameter (30, 60, 90, 180 days). ZOLL Billing will then go through all your payments by payer to determine averages - which display on page one of the report.

text.text: What parameter options do I have when running the Projected Revenue report?

text: To run the Projected Revenue report, you need to pick a parameter (30, 60, 90, 180 days). ZOLL Billing will then go through all your payments by payer to determine averages - which display on page one of the report.

text.text: What information does the first page of the Projected Revenue report display?

text: The first page of the Projected Revenue report displays the following information: Average Claim Payment Over Last 90 Days, Claim Count, Average Claim Payment, Total Payments.

text.text: What details are provided on the subsequent pages of the Projected Revenue report?

text: The subsequent pages of the Projected Revenue report display the following information: Average Claim Payment By Payor Over Last 90 Days, Average Claim Payment By Payor And Policy Over Last 90 Days.

text.text: What actions should I take based on the information provided in the Projected Revenue report?

text: The next page(s) of the report show all your submitted open claims and a projected revenue based on those claims. You can also run the report daily to compare the posted amount to your bank statement.

text.text: What is the significance of the projected revenue total at the bottom of the report?

text: The projected revenue total at the bottom of the report is the amount of money you expect to receive from your submitted open claims. You can run the report daily to compare the posted amount to your bank statement.

text.text: Can I adjust the projected revenue calculation based on specific criteria?

text: To run the report, you need to pick a parameter (30, 60, 90, 180 days). ZOLL Billing will then go through all your payments by payer to determine averages - which display on page one of the report.

text.text: How to run a report?

text: To run a report, you need to go to the navigation bar and click Analytics and then Reports. You can then scroll down the list and click on the report you want to run.
